Package org.svvrl.goal.gui

Class UIUtil

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.gui.UIUtil
public class UIUtil
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides several utilities methods.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • getAccetpedEditable

      public static java.util.List<Pair<Window,​Tab>> getAccetpedEditable​(FilterRule<Editable> rule)
      Returns tabs that contain editable objects satisfying a specified filter rule.
      Parameters:
      rule - a filter rule
      Returns:
      tabs that contain editable objects satisfying a specified filter rule

    • promptSelection

      public static Tab promptSelection​(java.awt.Component parent, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String desc, FilterRule<Editable> rule) throws NoAcceptableObjectException
      Displays a dialog for selecting an object from objects that satisfy a specified filter rule. Note that the object in the active tab will be excluded.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent component of the dialog
      title - the title of the dialog
      desc - a description shown in the dialog
      rule - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected
      Returns:
      the tab containing the selected object, or null if the selection is canceled
      Throws:
      NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

    • promptSelection

      public static Tab[] promptSelection​(java.awt.Component parent, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.String[] names, FilterRule<Editable>[] rules) throws NoAcceptableObjectException
      Displays a dialog for selecting objects that satisfy specified filter rules.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent component of the dialog
      title - the title of the dialog
      desc - a description shown in the dialog
      names - a name for a selection
      rules - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected in a selection
      Returns:
      the tab containing the selected object, or null if the selection is canceled
      Throws:
      NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

    • promptSelection

      public static <T extends Properties> Pair<Tab,​T> promptSelection​(Window window, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String desc, FilterRule<Editable> rule, OptionsPanel<T> panel) throws NoAcceptableObjectException
      Displays a dialog for (1) selecting an object from objects that satisfy a specified filter rule and (2) adjusting options. Note that the object in the active tab will be excluded.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of options
      Parameters:
      window - the parent window of the dialog
      title - the title of the dialog
      desc - a description shown in the dialog
      rule - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected
      panel - an options panel
      Returns:
      a pair of the tab containing the selected object and the options, or null if the selection is canceled
      Throws:
      NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

      Binds key strokes to an action in a component.
      Parameters:
      comp - a component
      action - an action
      strokes - key strokes

    • setWindowOpacity

      public static boolean setWindowOpacity​(java.awt.Window window, float opacity)
      Makes a window translucent.
      Parameters:
      window - a window to be made translucent
      opacity - the translucent level
      Returns:
      true if the window is made translucent successfully

      Parameters:

      shape - the shape of the window
      Returns:
      true if the shape is set successfully

    • wrapInHTML

      public static java.lang.String wrapInHTML​(java.lang.String str, int width)
      Wraps text into lines between <html> and </html>. The HTML tag <br/> is used as the line break.
      Parameters:
      str - a string to be wrapped
      width - the maximum width of each line
      Returns:
      the wrapped text

    • wrapTooltip

      public static java.lang.String wrapTooltip​(java.lang.String str)
      Wraps tooltip text in HTML for Windows platforms. This method does nothing for Macs.
      Parameters:
      str - a string to be wrapped
      Returns:
      the wrapped string if the platform is Microsoft Windows, or the original input string if the platform is Mac

    • wrapLabel

      public static javax.swing.JLabel wrapLabel​(java.lang.String str, int width)
      Wraps the text in a label with a preferred width on the screen. The height will be computed automatically. This method does not break the text into lines but just sets an appropriate height for the returned label.
      Parameters:
      str - the text to be wrapped
      width - the preferred width of the label on the screen
      Returns:
      a label with the text

    • setColor

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setColor​(GraphicComponent[] comps, java.awt.Color color, boolean extend)
      Sets the color of an array of graphic components. If the argument extend is true and the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the color, it will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      comps - graphic components
      color - the new color, which must be non-null
      extend - indicating if transitions should be extended
      Returns:
      an undoable edit of this color changing, null if no component is changed

    • setTextColor

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setTextColor​(GraphicComponent[] comps, java.awt.Color color, boolean extend)
      Sets the text color of an array of graphic components. If the argument extend is true and the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the color, it will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      comps - graphic components
      color - the new text color, which must be non-null
      extend - indicating if transitions should be extended
      Returns:
      an undoable edit of this color changing, null if no component is changed

    • setOpacity

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setOpacity​(GraphicComponent[] comps, int opacity)
      Sets the opacity of an array of graphic components. If the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the opacity, it will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      comps - graphic components
      opacity - the new opacity
      Returns:
      an undoable edit of this opacity changing, null if no component is changed

    • resetOpacity

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit resetOpacity​(Automaton aut)
      Resets the opacity of all states and transitions of an automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton
      Returns:
      an undoable edit for this opacity reset

      Resets the color of all states and transitions of an automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton
      Returns:
      an undoable edit for this color reset

    • resetColor

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit resetColor​(GraphicComponent[] comps)
      Resets the color of some states and transitions of an automaton.
      Parameters:
      comps - states and transitions with colors to be reset
      Returns:
      an undoable edit for this color reset

    • resetTextColor

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit resetTextColor​(Automaton aut)
      Resets the text color of all states and transitions of an automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton
      Returns:
      an undoable edit for this color reset

    • resetTextColor

      public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit resetTextColor​(GraphicComponent[] comps)
      Resets the text color of some states and transitions of an automaton.
      Parameters:
      comps - states and transitions with text colors to be reset
      Returns:
      an undoable edit for this color reset

    • scroll

      public static void scroll​(javax.swing.JScrollPane pane, java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent e, int incr)
      Scrolls a scroll pane based on a mouse wheel event.
      Parameters:
      pane - a scroll pane
      e - a mouse wheel event
      incr - the unit of increment

    • animatedMove

      public static void animatedMove​(State[] states, java.awt.geom.Point2D[] destinations, AutomatonCanvas<?> canvas, int frames, int interval)
      Moves states to their new destinations slowly.
      Parameters:
      states - an array of states
      destinations - destinations of the states
      canvas - the canvas displaying these states
      frames - total number of frames to be played
      interval - time interval between two frames

    • getSelectedAsAutomaton

      public static Automaton getSelectedAsAutomaton​(AutomatonEditor<?> editor)
      Returns a new automaton that contains only the selected states in an automaton editor. Transitions between the selected states will also be included in the returned automaton.
      Parameters:
      editor - an automaton editor
      Returns:
      a new automaton that contains only the selected states

    • getSelectedAsAutomatonEx

      public static Automaton getSelectedAsAutomatonEx​(AutomatonEditor<?> editor)
      Returns a new automaton that contains only the selected states in an automaton editor. Transitions between the selected states will also be included in the returned automaton. If no state is selected, a copy of the whole automaton is returned.
      Parameters:
      editor - an automaton editor
      Returns:
      a new automaton that contains only the selected states or a copy of the automaton if no state is selected
